paper_metadata.title: Working in six countries with an international consortium: Investigating the Graduation program

program_information.country: Multiple (Ethiopia, Ghana, Honduras, India, Pakistan, Peru)

component_a_cash_support.cash_evidence_citation: The program targets the poorest members in a village and provides a productive asset grant, training and support, life skills coaching, temporary cash consumption support

component_b_assets.assets_evidence_citation: The program targets the poorest members in a village and provides a productive asset grant

study_characteristics.outcomes_evidence_citation: Productive assets, income, and revenue go up. Although results vary across countries, the general pattern of positive effects that persist for at least a year after the program concludes is common across all countries
study_characteristics.design_evidence_citation: Following standard practice in the analysis of multi-site trials, we estimate a single model, with strata and country dummies

evidence_citations.program_name_citation: Working in six countries with an international consortium, we investigate whether a multifaceted Graduation program can help the extreme poor
evidence_citations.country_citation: Ethiopia Ghana Honduras India Pakistan Peru
evidence_citations.target_population_citation: The program targets the poorest members in a village
